00026 #include "lpc17xx_libcfg.h"
00027 #include "debug_frmwrk.h"

00032 /* Example group ----------------------------------------------------------- */
00038 /************************** PRIVATE VARIABLES *************************/
00039 uint8_t menu[]=
00040         "********************************************************************************\n\r"
00041         "Hello NXP Semiconductors \n\r"
00042         "System Tick demo \n\r"
00043         "\t - MCU: LPC17xx \n\r"
00044         "\t - Core: ARM CORTEX-M3 \n\r"
00045         "\t - Communicate via: UART0 - 115200 bps \n\r"
00046         "This example used TIMERs to generate 4 PWM signals with different duty cycles \n\r"
00047         "********************************************************************************\n\r";
00048 FunctionalState PWM0_State = ENABLE;
00049 FunctionalState PWM1_State = ENABLE;
00050 FunctionalState PWM2_State = ENABLE;
00051 FunctionalState PWM3_State = ENABLE;
00052 
00053 TIM_TIMERCFG_Type TIM_ConfigStruct;
00054 TIM_MATCHCFG_Type TIM_MatchConfigStruct;
00055 
00056 /************************** PRIVATE FUNCTIONS *************************/
00057 void TIMER0_IRQHandler(void);
00058 void TIMER1_IRQHandler(void);
00059 void TIMER2_IRQHandler(void);
00060 void TIMER3_IRQHandler(void);
00061 
00062 void print_menu(void);
00063 
00064 /*----------------- INTERRUPT SERVICE ROUTINES --------------------------*/
00065 /*********************************************************************/
00070 void TIMER0_IRQHandler(void)
00071 {
00072         //duty cycle = 12.5%
00073         TIM_Cmd(LPC_TIM0,DISABLE);
00074         TIM_ClearIntPending(LPC_TIM0, TIM_MR0_INT);
00075         TIM_ResetCounter(LPC_TIM0);
00076         if((PWM0_State == ENABLE))
00077         {
00078                 TIM_UpdateMatchValue(LPC_TIM0, 0, 100);
00079                 PWM0_State = DISABLE;
00080         }
00081         else
00082         {
00083                 TIM_UpdateMatchValue(LPC_TIM0, 0, 700);
00084                 PWM0_State = ENABLE;
00085         }
00086         TIM_Cmd(LPC_TIM0,ENABLE);
00087 }
00088 
00089 /*********************************************************************/
00094 void TIMER1_IRQHandler(void)
00095 {
00096         //duty cycle = 25%
00097         TIM_Cmd(LPC_TIM1,DISABLE);
00098         TIM_ClearIntPending(LPC_TIM1, TIM_MR0_INT);
00099         TIM_ResetCounter(LPC_TIM1);
00100         if((PWM1_State == ENABLE))
00101         {
00102                 TIM_UpdateMatchValue(LPC_TIM1,0, 200);
00103                 PWM1_State = DISABLE;
00104         }
00105         else
00106         {
00107                 TIM_UpdateMatchValue(LPC_TIM1,0, 600);
00108                 PWM1_State = ENABLE;
00109         }
00110         TIM_Cmd(LPC_TIM1,ENABLE);
00111 }
00112 
00113 /*********************************************************************/
00118 void TIMER2_IRQHandler(void)
00119 {
00120         //duty cycle = 37,5%
00121         TIM_Cmd(LPC_TIM2,DISABLE);
00122         TIM_ClearIntPending(LPC_TIM2, TIM_MR0_INT);
00123         TIM_ResetCounter(LPC_TIM2);
00124         if((PWM2_State == ENABLE))
00125         {
00126                 TIM_UpdateMatchValue(LPC_TIM2,0, 300);
00127                 PWM2_State = DISABLE;
00128         }
00129         else
00130         {
00131                 TIM_UpdateMatchValue(LPC_TIM2,0, 500);
00132                 PWM2_State = ENABLE;
00133         }
00134         TIM_Cmd(LPC_TIM2,ENABLE);
00135 }
00136 
00137 /*********************************************************************/
00142 void TIMER3_IRQHandler(void)
00143 {
00144         //duty cycle = 50%
00145         TIM_Cmd(LPC_TIM3,DISABLE);
00146         TIM_ClearIntPending(LPC_TIM3, TIM_MR0_INT);
00147         TIM_ResetCounter(LPC_TIM3);
00148         TIM_Cmd(LPC_TIM3,ENABLE);
00149 }

00163 
00164 /*-------------------------MAIN FUNCTION------------------------------*/
00165 /*********************************************************************/
00170 int c_entry (void)
00171 {
00172         PINSEL_CFG_Type PinCfg;
00173 
00174         /* Initialize debug via UART0
00175          * – 115200bps
00176          * – 8 data bit
00177          * – No parity
00178          * – 1 stop bit
00179          * – No flow control
00180          */
00181         debug_frmwrk_init();
00182 
00183         // print welcome screen
00184         print_menu();
00185 
00186         /* Select pin:
00187          * P1.28: MAT0.0
00188          * P1.22: MAT1.0
00189          * P0.6:  MAT2.0
00190          * P0.10: MAT3.0
00191          */
00192         PinCfg.Funcnum = 3;
00193         PinCfg.OpenDrain = 0;
00194         PinCfg.Pinmode = 0;
00195         PinCfg.Portnum = 1;
00196         PinCfg.Pinnum = 28;
00197         PINSEL_ConfigPin(&PinCfg);
00198         PinCfg.Pinnum = 22;
00199         PINSEL_ConfigPin(&PinCfg);
00200         PinCfg.Portnum = 0;
00201         PinCfg.Pinnum = 6;
00202         PINSEL_ConfigPin(&PinCfg);
00203         PinCfg.Pinnum = 10;
00204         PINSEL_ConfigPin(&PinCfg);
00205 
00206         // Initialize 4 timers, prescale count time of 100uS
00207         TIM_ConfigStruct.PrescaleOption = TIM_PRESCALE_USVAL;
00208         TIM_ConfigStruct.PrescaleValue  = 100;
00209 
00210         TIM_Init(LPC_TIM0, TIM_TIMER_MODE,&TIM_ConfigStruct);
00211         TIM_Init(LPC_TIM1, TIM_TIMER_MODE,&TIM_ConfigStruct);
00212         TIM_Init(LPC_TIM2, TIM_TIMER_MODE,&TIM_ConfigStruct);
00213         TIM_Init(LPC_TIM3, TIM_TIMER_MODE,&TIM_ConfigStruct);
00214 
00215         // Configure 4 match channels
00216         // use channel 0, MR0
00217         TIM_MatchConfigStruct.MatchChannel = 0;
00218         // Enable interrupt when MR0 matches the value in TC register
00219         TIM_MatchConfigStruct.IntOnMatch   = TRUE;
00220         //Enable reset on MR0: TIMER will reset if MR0 matches it
00221         TIM_MatchConfigStruct.ResetOnMatch = TRUE;
00222         //Stop on MR0 if MR0 matches it
00223         TIM_MatchConfigStruct.StopOnMatch  = FALSE;
00224         //Toggle MR0 pin if MR0 matches it
00225         TIM_MatchConfigStruct.ExtMatchOutputType = TIM_EXTMATCH_TOGGLE;
00226         // Set Match value
00227         TIM_MatchConfigStruct.MatchValue   = 700;
00228         // Set configuration for Tim_MatchConfig
00229         TIM_ConfigMatch(LPC_TIM0,&TIM_MatchConfigStruct);
00230         TIM_MatchConfigStruct.MatchValue   = 600;
00231         TIM_ConfigMatch(LPC_TIM1,&TIM_MatchConfigStruct);
00232         TIM_MatchConfigStruct.MatchValue   = 500;
00233         TIM_ConfigMatch(LPC_TIM2,&TIM_MatchConfigStruct);
00234         TIM_MatchConfigStruct.MatchValue   = 800;
00235         TIM_ConfigMatch(LPC_TIM3,&TIM_MatchConfigStruct);
00236 
00237         /* preemption = 1, sub-priority = 1 */
00238         NVIC_SetPriority(TIMER0_IRQn, ((0x01<<3)|0x01));
00239         /* Enable interrupt for timer 0 */
00240         NVIC_EnableIRQ(TIMER0_IRQn);
00241         // To start timer 0
00242         TIM_Cmd(LPC_TIM0,ENABLE);
00243 
00244         /* preemption = 1, sub-priority = 1 */
00245         NVIC_SetPriority(TIMER1_IRQn, ((0x01<<3)|0x02));
00246         /* Enable interrupt for timer 1 */
00247         NVIC_EnableIRQ(TIMER1_IRQn);
00248         // To start timer 1
00249         TIM_Cmd(LPC_TIM1,ENABLE);
00250 
00251         /* preemption = 1, sub-priority = 1 */
00252         NVIC_SetPriority(TIMER2_IRQn, ((0x01<<3)|0x03));
00253         /* Enable interrupt for timer 1 */
00254         NVIC_EnableIRQ(TIMER2_IRQn);
00255         // To start timer 1
00256         TIM_Cmd(LPC_TIM2,ENABLE);
00257 
00258         /* preemption = 1, sub-priority = 1 */
00259         NVIC_SetPriority(TIMER3_IRQn, ((0x01<<3)|0x04));
00260         /* Enable interrupt for timer 1 */
00261         NVIC_EnableIRQ(TIMER3_IRQn);
00262         // To start timer 1
00263         TIM_Cmd(LPC_TIM3,ENABLE);
00264 
00265         while(1);
00266         return (1);
00267 }
00268 
00269 
00270 /* With ARM and GHS toolsets, the entry point is main() - this will
00271    allow the linker to generate wrapper code to setup stacks, allocate
00272    heap area, and initialize and copy code and data segments. For GNU
00273    toolsets, the entry point is through __start() in the crt0_gnu.asm
00274    file, and that startup code will setup stacks and data */
00275 int main(void)
00276 {
00277     return c_entry();
00278 }

00280 #ifdef  DEBUG
00281 /*******************************************************************************
00282 * @brief                Reports the name of the source file and the source line number
00283 *                               where the CHECK_PARAM error has occurred.
00284 * @param[in]    file Pointer to the source file name
00285 * @param[in]    line assert_param error line source number
00286 * @return               None
00287 *******************************************************************************/
00288 void check_failed(uint8_t *file, uint32_t line)
00289 {
00290         /* User can add his own implementation to report the file name and line number,
00291          ex: printf("Wrong parameters value: file %s on line %d\r\n", file, line) */
00292 
00293         /* Infinite loop */
00294         while(1);
00295 }
